Create parameter handler

Returns string of help info on parameters. If given a parameter shortcut, returns a string of help information: Usage: - / --= / If not given a parameter shortcut, returns a string of global help information: Usage: [-] [-] ... - / -- ... @param string $short Shortcut of the parameter to get help text for. @return string See description. @link ezcConsoleParameterException::CODE_EXISTANCE}.
Source -> Destination
//autogen// @copyright Copyright (C) 2005 eZ syst
Jan Borsodi
Automatically wrap text to fit into a column. @see ezcConsoleTable::$options
Do not wrap text. Columns will be extended to fit the largest text. ATTENTION: This is riscy! @see ezcConsoleTable::$options
Text will be cut to fit into a column. @see ezcConsoleTable::$options

UML:Expression.body:
array( 'colWidth' => 'auto', // Automatically define column width. Else array of width // per column like array( 0 => 10, 1 => 15, 2 => 5,...); 'colWrap' => WRAP_AUTO,
'lineTop' => '-', 'lineBottom' => '-', 'lineLeft' => '|', 'lineRight' => '|',
'cornerTopLeft' => '+', 'cornerBottomLeft' => '+', 'cornerTopRight' => '+', 'cornerBottomRight' => '+',
'lineColor' => 'default', 'lineColorHead' => 'default', )

UML:TaggedValue.value: Options for the table. @var array(string)
Returns the table in a string. Returns the entire table as a string. @return string
Output the table. Prints the complete table to the console. @return void
//autogen// @copyright Copyright (C) 2005 eZ syst
Jan Borsodi

UML:Expression.body: array( 'barChar' => '+', // Char to fill progress bar with 'emptyChar' => ' ', // Char to fill empty space in progress bar with 'progressChar' => '>', // Right most char of the progress bar filling 'formatString' => '[%bar%] %percent% %', // Format string 'width' => 100, // Maximum width of the progressbar )

UML:TaggedValue.value: Start the progress bar Starts the progess bar and sticks it to the current line. No output will be done yet. Call {@link ezcConsoleProgressbar::output()} to print the bar. @return void
Draw the progress bar. Prints the progressbar to the screen. If start() has not been called yet, the current line is used for {@link ezcConsolProgressbar::start()}.

Advance the progress bar. Advances the progress bar by one step. Redraws the bar by default, using the {@link ezcConsoleProgressbar::output()} method. @param bool Whether to redraw the bar immediatelly.
Jan Borsodi
